profileText: (Wife of Hubert Horatio Humphrey, Jr., later Muriel Humphrey Brown), a Senator from Minnesota; born Muriel Fay Buck in Huron, Beadle County, S.Dak., February 20, 1912; educated in the public schools; attended Huron College; appointed on January 25, 1978, as a Democrat to the United States Senate to fill the vacancy caused by the death of her husband, Hubert Horatio Humphrey, Jr., and served from January 25, 1978, to November 7, 1978; was not a candidate for election to the unexpired term; was a resident of Plymouth, Minnesota until her death on September 20, 1998; interment in Lakewood Cemetery in Minneapolis.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Muriel Humphrey," in Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & Preservation, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 2006.

researchRecord.name: Correspondence in Margaret Bayne Price papers, 1918-1969; Blair Moody papers, 1928-1954; and Read Bain papers, 1893-1972. Finding aid.

1924, 1950-1982, 140 feet. Correspondence, memoranda, speeches, printed and mimeographed materials, and related papers. The majority of the papers are organized by year, and within each year into two segments: general subject files, and subject files dealing with mental health and intellectual disabilities. Control correspondence files (carbon copies of outgoing letters, organized alphabetically by recipient) are also included with the files for most years. Included in the general subject files is her correspondence with and about family members and friends. Also present are campaign files for 1964 and 1972; her speeches for 1965-1976; printed materials of various kinds relating to mental disabilities; and assorted plaques, awards, certificates, and family memorabilia. Finding aid available online. Represented in numerous other collections.
1 audiotape (1971) in Westinghouse Broadcasting Company collection, 1945-1981.

In the Papers of Marjorie Chambers, 1943-2010 (inclusive), 1953-1995 (bulk); Papers of Betty Friedan, 1933-198; Photographs of Diana Mara Henry, 1969-1985; Papers of Frances Humphrey Howard, 1923-2003 (inclusive), 1961-2002 (bulk); Photographs of Diana Mara Henry, 1969-1985 1969-1985; Records of the National Organization for Women, 1959-2002; Papers of Esther Peterson, 1884-1998 (inclusive), 1929-1988 (bulk); Papers of Marguerite Rawalt, 1870s-1989; Records of the Women's Equity Action League, 1967-1990; Records of the National Women's Political Caucus, 1970-2006; Papers of Elizabeth Holtzman, 1945-1981 (inclusive), 1972-1980 (bulk) 1945-1981.

recordLocation.name: Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study, Harvard University

researchRecord.name: In the Edward William Brooke papers, 1941-2015; Daniel P. Moynihan papers, 1765-2003.
Correspondence and photograph in the Hugh Scott Papers, 1930-1987. Correspondence in the Harry F. Byrd, Jr. Papers ca. 1954-1982; Papers of William B. Spong, 1965-1974.
In the Marlene Sanders Papers, 1933-2006, 2014, 2 items. Film, profiles of Pat Nixon and Muriel Humphrey; Interview with Muriel Humphrey.
